activities.name: Role Play
activities.content: Have studnets write a role-play and perform it in front of the class.

activities.name: Kung-Fu Phonics
activities.content:
Prepare a list of minimal-pairs phonics. 
Have the students stand up. 
 Assign a phonic sound to either a punch or a kick. 
 Say a minimal pair word on your list, students then punch or kick. 
 If they do the wrong action, they sit down. 
 play until there is a winner.

activities.name: Shadowing
activities.content:
Teacher and a volunteer will read prepared role plays for the students to listen to. 
 Disccuss the role plays, and then have the students shadow after you and the volunteer.

activities.name: Find Your Match
activities.content:
Students are given part of a role play. 
 They have to walk around the classroom saying their role play to see if they can find their other half. 
 When they have a match, they perform it for the teacher, and are given a new half of a role play.
  How many role plays can they finish?

activities.name: Criss Cross
activities.content:
'Students stand up. 
 Teachers ask questions based on the grammar point learnt. If a student answers the question. they get to choose how to sit down.

activities.name: The Who Am I? Guessing Game
activities.content: Type up a list of between 15-20 names of current famous people, e.g. Madonna, Tom Cruise, etc. and cut into slips of paper approx. 1 1/2 by 3 and Pin a slip of paper onto each students back. Students circulate and ask each other Yes or No questions about the persons name pinned to their backs until they guess who they are. Elizabeth, Vancouver, BC, Canada

activities.name: 60 Second Quiz
activities.content: Students write 25 words and their translations on a piece of paper, give them time to do this When time is up, one student will read a their native language word to the students and the give them the work in English. The student that give the translation to the most words in 60 seconds is the winner give them the work in English. The student that give the translation to the most words in 60 seconds is the winner give them the work in English. The student that give the translation to the most words in 60 seconds is the winner.

activities.name: `Karuta
activities.content: have a lst of cards with words that sudents are learning. Students place it face up between them in the groups. The teacher reads the words, and the student have to find that word and slap it. the first student to slap the card is the gets the card. the winner is the student with the most cards at the end of the day.

activities.name: ALTs Day
activities.content: Write an essay about your life using known grammar forms and/or target grammar forms. If you use unfamiliar vocabulary, provide Japanese translations (ask your JTE for help). Choose 5-10 words and change them into blanks.  The ALT reads his/her essay 2-3 times. The students listen and try to fill in the blanks by catching the sound. After the ALT has finished reading, the JTE reads the essay one more time, pausing before each blank. The class says the correct answer in unison. The ALT writes the correct spelling on the board.
How many dogs/cats/etc do you have?
